answerText: Thomas Browne[10] This author, who extolled Browne's "little twist in the brains" in a letter, may be better known for poems like "Kubla Khan" and "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner."
heading: NASAT |2013 | 7 | 8 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The first and last sections of W. G. Sebald's The Rings of Saturn consider this writer, whose minor works include Religio Medici and The Garden of Cyrus. For 10 points each: [10] Name this 17th-century English prose author who was inspired by an archaeological find in Norfolk to write his most famous work, Hydriotaphia, or Urn-Burial.
